stateCompliance.headline: California Cash Advance Laws Protecting Bakersfield Residents
stateCompliance.content: Bakersfield residents are protected by California Deferred Deposit Transaction Law, administered by the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI). California has some of the strictest payday loan regulations in the nation, including loan amount limits, fee caps, and strong consumer protections that prevent predatory lending practices.
keyPoints: Maximum loan amount: $300 including all fees (typical cash amount is $255 with $45 fee)
Maximum fee: 15% of the check amount, which equals approximately 460% APR for a 14-day loan
Loan term limit: Cannot exceed 31 days
One loan at a time: You can only have one payday loan outstanding with us at any given time
No rollovers: California law prohibits rolling over loans for additional fees
No criminal prosecution: Lenders cannot threaten or pursue criminal charges for non-payment
Limited NSF fees: Only one $15 NSF fee is allowed if your check bounces
Clear fee disclosure: All fees must be clearly stated in both dollars and APR
Licensed lenders only: Verify any payday lender's California DFPI license before borrowing
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI)
stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is for general educational purposes and does not constitute legal advice. Payday loan laws and regulations may change. For the most current information, contact the DFPI at 1-866-275-2677 or visit dfpi.ca.gov. If you have specific legal questions, consult with a licensed California attorney. Individual lender terms may vary within the limits allowed by California law.
